attributes.action: Create an official medal for emergency services involved in the London attacks.
attributes.background: Reward of a medal in recognition of the phenomenal service provided by London emergency services to all those involved in the summer 2017 London terrorist incidents, including emergency responders as well as investigation teams and counter terrorism officers.
attributes.additional_details: The London summer of 2017, has seen an unprecedented threat from terrorism, with attacks on Westminster Bridge, London Bridge & Borough Market, Finsbury Park, police officers close to Buckingham Palace and a London Underground train. The response of emergency services has been exceptional. This outstanding service to public/country has been publically recognised by the Prime Minster, the Mayor of London, and the Home secretary who rightly quantified that ‚Äúthere has been no summer like it‚Äù.

attributes.action: Stagger school holidays - stop holiday ripoffs
attributes.background: Companies massively increase the costs of holidays and days out during school holiday times in the UK.  By staggering the school holidays to spread demand, parents and those who work in education will be able to take advantage of cheaper prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Parent risk court fines in taking their children away in term-time to benefit from cheaper deals.

Time together as a family and learning about new cultures can be beneficial for children‚Äôs development and offers a valuable education alongside lessons taught in school

This petition calls for staggering school term dates by region, i.e. so if a parent has a child in a primary school and a secondary school in the same region, their holidays will be the same.

attributes.action: Paediatric mental health training within the NHS medical staff
attributes.background: The issue is that the paediatric medical staff (NHS) doesn't know how to deal with mental health at all when a child is admitted to the ward for observation, with mental health training the staff  would be able to provide a better duty of care. (See additional details for a personal story)
attributes.additional_details:
Backround:
The reason for this petition is that my child has multiple mental illnesses and has been hospitalised as a result of this 5 times in 2017, when at the emergency department a lot of the staff was unsure what to do, they just sent the child up to the paediatric ward to be in overnight until CAMHS would arrive. However in all instances the staff was unsure what to do.

attributes.action: Ban all non-recycled (in UK) single use food containers and utensils.
attributes.background:
With current bio-technological alternatives to almost all disposable food container and utensil, it is unacceptable that current wasteful practices have not been eliminated from our society.

Until organisations can prove that all materials used in packaging is recycled, a total ban is required.
attributes.additional_details:
In early 2017 a petition 'Ban all non-recyclable/non-compostable packaging in the UK' was debated. Although this raised many valid and relevant points, it did not provide a clear strategy dealing with the problem. With the bio-plastic alternatives available, legislation is required to tackle this.

Although some big corporations have paid lip service to sustainability (E.G. In store coffee cup recycling schemes), the impact will alway be superficial.

Please read the original debate responses.

attributes.action: Abolish Parking Charges in hospital car parks!
attributes.background:
When people visit a hospital, they have to pay to park. Whilst parking for the disabled is free, everyone else has to pay.
People should not have to pay when they visit a hospital. This should apply to both patients and visitors. Abolish Hospital Parking Charges!

attributes.action: Ensure that no claimant on benefits is left without financial support.
attributes.background: I am hearing about families losing their homes and needing to use food banks due to a sudden removal from one set of benefits to the new one:- universal credit. It can't be right - the benefits should run seamlessly into each other. This is totally inhumane.
attributes.additional_details: This has happened to someon I know with a disabled child.

attributes.action: To Put Mental Health medication on to the exemption list for a free prescription
attributes.background: I have been on Bipolar Medication for a while. Like others who have various mental health problems, I can't get it for free as it is not on the exemption list. However I am on this medication for the rest of my life. It should be on the list because like most medications on the list, it's for life.
attributes.additional_details: Most people I know on these medications can't get it for free and have to pay ¬£8.70 just for the medication, however people with thyroid problems and other problems can get it for free and all their other medications for free! Why when this is a condition that we must have our tablets every day otherwise become very ill and put into hospital can we not get it? This is an issue that needs to be spoken about mental health has to be spoken up about. It's difficult going through this and getting help.

attributes.action: Discuss regulating veterinary practices and the excessive fees they charge.
attributes.background:
Veterinary fees are excessive and affect the consumer in many ways. The fees also push up the pet insurance fees where many pet owners cannot afford these. 
The vets know the owners don't have the money and then charge excessively knowing the owner will pay the fees to protect their beloved pet.
attributes.additional_details:
Vets Now recently charged ¬£140 for emergency consultation, to update the database ¬£17 and admit the pet to hospital ¬£200.80 then administer the medication, blood test and scan which eventually totalled ¬£702.04. A further ¬£700 was issued and then consulation and putting the pet to sleep costing ¬£240. 
The total cost was ¬£1640.84 with VAT and didn't result in saving the life of the pet as the Vet wanted more money costing over ¬£3000. 
Ridiculous prices which need agreeing and regulating.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for alcoholic drinks to list all ingredients.
attributes.background:
I have a severe life threatening allergy to the artificial colourant E110 (Sunset Yellow) and nuts.

Alcoholic drinks in the UK do NOT have to list their ingredients anywhere, not on the product nor online. 

This is so unsafe for people who have allergies and could lead to preventable deaths

attributes.action: Eliminate financial requirement for UK citizens bringing legal spouses to the UK
attributes.background: Currently EU citizens can settle their non-EU spouses in the UK on proof of a legal marriage. For UK citizens there are additional income or capital requirements. These additional requirements discriminate against UK citizens and can prevent resettlement of their non-EU spouses.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules for British citizens to bring non-EU spouses to the UK are forcing some to have to leave the UK or abandon their spouse. The Government should be looking after these citizens above all others. British citizens shouldn't have to face this government imposed dilemma of choosing between their spouse and their country.
 
This petition proposes the elimination of the income and capital hurdles that discriminate against UK citizens settling their legal spouses in the UK.

attributes.action: Reduce The Minimum Income Requirement for Spouse Visa
attributes.background: Government should reduce the minimum income requirement for British spouse visa, from ¬£18,600 to ¬£14,400. In many jobs, a person can save a lot from their monthly income and can provide for two people (themselves and the spouse) without relying on public funds. The incomes are lower outside London.
attributes.additional_details: Many British citizens working in the UK on slightly lower pay, especially outside London. They‚Äôre employed and the income they earn are enough to provide for themselves and the spouse. The government should consider this. In Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland, the income rates are lower than England.

attributes.action: Update the driving licence point system from 12 points to at least 15-20
attributes.background: The points system was introduced in 1988 which is nearly 30 years ago. There are so many things you can get points for these days that were not about then. All I'm asking is for the people that are at say one more defective tyre or something away from an automatic ban because of the tot up.
attributes.additional_details: It should still be an instant ban for drink, drug driving. There are more and more ways now to get points than there was when this was introduced.

attributes.action: Waive the two child cap on tax credits for mothers working minimum 18 hours/week
attributes.background: After April 2017, no woman will be able to claim or receive any Tax credits for a third child, unless the child is born as a multiple birth or conceived as a result of a sexual assault. This approach is callous, as well as ignorant, as many women live with men that force them to get pregnant.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government deems third babies a luxury not every family has earned, though the royal‚Äôs third baby will be taken care of, courtesy of the TAXPAYER (who's being penalised the same as those who do not work at all).
As long as a woman is in paid work, she should be able to receive tax credit support.
For each child conceived, I believe 6 hours of work is ideal - e.g: 18 hours for 3 children, 24 hours for 4 children, 30 hours for 5 children.
A cap on 5 children (with the exception of one multiple birth of twins) is fair.
If a working mother falls ill or disabled as an unforseeable result, I believe her claim for tax credits should continue. However, a cap should be placed on any children following her illness, unless she is able to return back to work.

attributes.action: Teach domestic abuse to all children in schools
attributes.background: As a single mother of 4 daughters, I have gone through domestic abuse and I am trying to bring my daughters up to know this is wrong, and as they spend a lot of time at school I think all children, girls and boys, would benefit from this being taught at school.
attributes.additional_details:
With domestic abuse on the rise we need to educate our children that this is wrong and not to put up with it. This is the only way to stop this moving on to the next generation. 

We also need to start making parents responsible for the actions of their abusive children. We are fined if our child misses too much school

attributes.action: Commit to increasing the size of the Royal Navy by at least 20% over 50 years
attributes.background: Historically, the Royal Navy was the best in the world. Now, it's barely in the top ten. We need to be secure, it's not a luxury but a requirement. While the existing fleet is well equipped, there aren't enough ships to be everywhere needed. 20% in 50 years isn't a huge increase, but it's a start.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Navy currently has under eighty commissioned ships. Only 3/4 of those are operational at any one time. These numbers are too small, especially compared to the 430 ships of the US Navy or the nearly 500 ships of China. In 1945 at the end of the Second World War, the Royal Navy had 900 ships, today's navy is less than 1% the size of then. We don't need to increase back to wartime levels, but we do need to increase the Navy's size considerably.

attributes.action: End free movement of pets to UK to prevent parasite blinding people and pets.
attributes.background: The pet passport scheme allows EU pets to pass through borders without quarantine allowing the spread of an oriental eye worm that blinds both animals and people. We must quarantine travelling animals and treat them if infected. Infections in humans have been reported throughout mainland Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/oriental-eye-worm-infection-dogs-blindness-spread-uk-thelazia-callipaeda-a7955711.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-4901936/UK-pets-owners-risk-blinding-eye-infection.html

attributes.action: Stop Kim Jong Un from ever coming to the UK.
attributes.background: Kim Jong Un is becoming increasingly powerful and reckless, we can't allow a man like that in our country.

attributes.action: Prevent the tunnel proposals for the A303 under Stonehenge.
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a historic world heritage sight and the proposals to construct a tunnel will seriously damage the local wildlife and the countryside around the famous and ancient historical sight.

attributes.action: More funding towards cure research for Type 1 Diabetes
attributes.background: In June 2017 at the age of 18, I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. Beforehand I was perfectly healthy. I did nothing to cause this to come on, nor does anyone else suffering from this unfair disease.
attributes.additional_details: I'm requesting far more funding to go towards finding a cure for Type 1 Diabetes so that people who suffer from this unfair disease can have some hope.

attributes.action: Fit all Heavy or Large Vehicles with Automatic Emergency Braking System (AEBS)
attributes.background: Horrific HGV accidents happen constantly. Automatic emergency braking systems could prevent many deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Humans are subject to fatigue, 'highway hypnosis', sudden medical problems and distractions. Automatic emergency brakes are not subject to any of these problems. According to Campaign For Better Transport: More than half (52%) of fatal accidents on motorways involve HGVs but only 10% of motorway vehicles are HGVs. HGVs are also involved in 1 in 5 fatal crashes on A and minor roads, and its worsening each year. Let's reverse this trend and use technology to prevent more deaths.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test every 5 years
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down. Drivers should be required to retake their test every 5 years after they turn 65.

attributes.action: Stop NHS Surcharge Payment for Visa applications (NI contributions goes to NHS)
attributes.background: The Home Office has made it mandatory for immigrants to pay for NHS Surcharge as part of Visa application while working immigrants in the UK pay National Insurance contribution that fund other state benefits and the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS Surcharge cost ¬£200 per year and this means immigrants have to pay an excess of ¬£200 every time they apply to renew their Visa on top of their high visa charge. For someone applying for 5 years visa, this will amount to an extra ¬£1000. National Insurance contribution means that immigrants are already paying contribution towards funding the NHS and should be given the right to access medical treatment and not treated differently from EU and UK citizens with regards to accessing the NHS

attributes.action: Companies must be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products
attributes.background: In my case, I have found that it is a common theme to find that "gelatine" is an ingredient to many confectionery items. This itself presents a grave concern, as I am a follower of the Islamic faith, who does not eat pork. Thus, failure to specify the type of gelatine is misleading.
attributes.additional_details: The rationale of ingredients being displayed on the back of food packaging is that we are in a position to exercise our autonomy. So, we can make an informed decision of whether or not it is something we wish to consume. This detail should be a basic requirement for all product packaging and be given the attention similar to allergy warnings. This applies to many sectors of society Muslims, Judaism, Hinduism, Sikhism and sects of Christianity. Therefore, essential in such a diverse society.

attributes.action: Lest we forget! Fly Union Flag all year round to mark centenary of end of WW1
attributes.background:
Next year marks the centenary of the end of the Great War.
As a mark of respect to the fallen who made the ultimate sacrifice so we could be free, we believe that the Union Flag should be flown on all Government buildings for the whole year.
attributes.additional_details:
At the going down of the sun and in the morning we will remember them.
Lest we forget.

attributes.action: Scrap VAT on Digital Books
attributes.background: Currently, Print books are exempt from VAT, whereas eBooks are subject to tax.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Government launched an action plan to inspire thousands more pupils to read in 2015, and that digital books are now the preferred medium for many, it makes no sense to tax youngsters whilst trying to increase readership.

If the Government are serious about tackling reading standards, scrapping the VAT on eBooks is surely one way to make a positive impact.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-action-plan-to-inspire-thousands-more-pupils-to-read

attributes.action: Stop pharmacies from being able to withhold medicines on the grounds of beliefs
attributes.background: I‚Äôve recently heard several women‚Äôs experiences of being withheld contraceptive medicines like the morning after pill because of pharmacists' personal beliefs.
attributes.additional_details: Through these experiences, many women are going home and worrying about possible pregnancy. In the health and social care industry, care and treatment cannot be withheld due to the personal beliefs of staff as it would be a violation of human rights. It shouldn‚Äôt be okay for pharmacists to withhold medicines from women on this basis - providing medicine and treatment for contraceptive purposes is a large role of a Pharmacist and failing to provide these is a failure in a first world country.

attributes.action: I would like to see it a legal requirement for cats to be microchipped
attributes.background: It would just make life alot simpler for vets & owners .If something happened to your cat at least you would know instead of forever hoping üò¢
attributes.additional_details: I run the group our pets uk and it's very sad the amount of cats that are killed in accidents , if they were microchipped owners would be notified .Cats do stray and would be easier to reunite with owners

attributes.action: Ban the use of ethylene glycol in antifreeze
attributes.background: As winter approaches, many of us put antifreeze in our engines for obvious reasons. I would like ethylene glycol to become a banned ingredient of antifreeze.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop people parking cars on communal lawns and grass verges.
attributes.background: When cars are parked on communal lawn areas in housing estates it causes the lawn to become messy with tyre ruts and it also makes the area look unsightly.This causes the ground to become uneven causing a trip hazard to the public. It also blocks the view of other drivers on the road.

attributes.action: Remove VAT on silver and platinum coins issued as legal tender.
attributes.background: The Royal Mint issues bullion and collectable coins in gold, silver and platinum. Gold is exempt from VAT but silver and platinum are not. There is no good reason for charging a value added sales tax on money at all. It is also inconsistent to have gold exempt.

attributes.action: Arm the Rohingya who are facing ethnic cleansing in Myanmar
attributes.background:
The Rohingya are the most persecuted ethnic minority group on Earth. Their villages are burnt to the ground by Burmese soldiers. Abuses include rape, killing civilians and burning villages.
 
The Rohingya need access to weapons to defend themselves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burmese military has committed harrowing atrocities against the Rohingya and we need to act in the same way that the international community acted when ISIS committed atrocities against the Kurds and Yazidis.
 
The UK should provide military and logistic assistance including arming Rohingya villagers so that they can sufficiently protect themselves against the rapists and killers.

attributes.action: Ban the use of farrowing crates in the UK
attributes.background: Farrowing crates, profoundly similar to sow crates which were banned in the UK in 1999, are long, narrow crates in which sows are contained during gestation. It's still legal to use farrowing crates in spite of them having the same implications to animal welfare as the sow/gestation crates.
attributes.additional_details: Pigs are intelligent, sentient beings and these crates deny their natural behaviours. This frustration can be displaced to damaging abnormal behaviours such as self-mutilation due to the intensive conditions. Farrowing crates severely restrict the sow's movement and deny them the instinctual urge to build a nest, worsening their frustrations. Having been made illegal in Sweden, Norway and Switzerland, we should follow this route of progression to maintain our reputation for good animal welfare.

attributes.action: Increase school funding in Hackney schools back to what it was.
attributes.background: Schools in Hackney are now really struggling in buying new resources especially that the new GCSE, A-Level and BTEC curriculum has been introduced. Schools need the resources, and they aren‚Äôt able to fund them.

attributes.action: Hold a debate in the Commons about the American gun control system
attributes.background: After the Vegas massacre, The Pulse night club shooting, San Bernardino, and a shooting yesterday in Fort Collins and countless other shootings, a debate is needed in the Commons about Gun control in the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017 in the US, 12,300 deaths have been caused by guns. 3,000 deaths are people who were under 18. There's been 286 mass shootings in the US. These figures don't include 22,000 annual suicides which use guns. If the UK had a similar population to the USA 1,000 UK citizens would die annually in comparison. 
http://www.gunviolencearchive.org/  
https://www.justfacts.com/guncontrol.asp  
https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/06/16/gun-violence-united-kingdom-united-states/85994716/

attributes.action: Stop all anonymous telephone calls and ban virtual telephone numbers.
attributes.background:
Householders across the UK are plagued by unsolicited telephone calls, which are increasingly automated. The majority of these calls arise from either with-held numbers or virtual numbers. 
The Government should make it illegal for Telephone Service Providers to pass on such telephone calls.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a simple matter for telephone service providers to identify both of these types of call and to prevent them from being put through to households; indeed, some companies will do this, at a price; effectively colluding with the "cold callers" to increase telephone service provider profits.
It is difficult to imagine a legal need for anyone to with-hold their telephone number or to pretend that they are calling from somewhere else, both of which actions are a deception.

attributes.action: Protect civilian war graves from the World wars
attributes.background: Having recently discovered that some civlian war graves are being overfilled for re-use,  I believe these should be rewarded due respect as are Military graves.
attributes.additional_details: Graves have already been overfilled at New Southgate and City of London cemetery (see https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/may/06/re-using-graves-means-uk-cemetery-will-never-run-out-of-space), are currently been threatened at Camberwell Cemetery and shortly so at Manor park cemetery

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016
attributes.background:
This act made the sale, distribution, and consumption of all psychoactive substances (with the exceptions of food, tobacco, alcohol, caffeine and poppers) illegal.
This a ridiculous piece of legislation that in no way serves public health or even law and order, and is in effect a ban on fun.
attributes.additional_details:
This legislation puts people at risk by sending these substances into the hands of criminal gangs. It also criminalises harmless drug users, putting them into contact with more dangerous offenders in prison, and increasing the already dangerously high prison population.
An evidence-based drugs policy will allow for properly safe, regulated use, and allow people who might have problems with these drugs to feel safe getting help. This law is a waste of police resources and an affront to freedom.

attributes.action: Working week to be split 40/60, weekend (Fri-Sun) weekday (Mon-Thurs)
attributes.background: I believe this should be considered with great thought as I think we over work ourseleves during the week and dont get enough breathing space to enjoy our own time and time with our familes, overworking can lead to mental and physical health issues so I believe this can help fix that.

attributes.action: To reopen Weston-Super-Mare's A&E between 10pm and 8am
attributes.background: W-S-M, A&E shut on July 4th 2017 due to the fragility of the emergency services due of the lack of senior doctors. At least 27 people use the emergency services each night; from those, 12 are transported by ambulance. Not having their local A&E at their disposal is endangering their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
One resident of Weston Super Mare stated,"We need our local A&E back. The delays encountered by ambulances having trawl between Taunton and Bristol are endangering lives."It's vital to keep this facility open 24 hours 7 days a week."
Another said..
"Please sign.. we need our local services. Bristol and Taunton are too far away, for the person having to care for them, for the ambulance service having to trawl back and forth and waiting times for ambulance services are endangering lives."

attributes.action: Move PMQ's to prime time on Tuesdays
attributes.background:
Prime Minister's Questions should be moved from 12pm on Wednesday to Tuesday evenings.

This will increase the amount of people able to watch PMQ's and participate in democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: I suggest Tuesdays as the best day as there aren't other popular shows on on a Tuesday, increasing the audience.

attributes.action: Offer tests for women on the NHS after ONE miscarriage
attributes.background: I have suffered 5 miscarriages in total, one being this year in 2017. I knew after the first two that something wasn‚Äôt right and pushed and pushed for testing. Unfortunately the NHS guidelines currently say that women need to have had 3 consecutive miscarriages before being offered tests.
attributes.additional_details: Now after 5 miscarriages I have been tested and found to have (aps) often known as sticky blood which means I would need a blood thinning injection daily if I was to become pregnant again. This could have saved my 5 babies‚Äô lives but because of this guidance, that unfortunately wasn‚Äôt the case. I am hoping to get this changed so other women like myself can get the answers and save the heartbreak please help.

attributes.action: Stop kids under 16 buying all energy drinks
attributes.background: Energy drinks are full of caffeine - no wonder kids have bad attitudes and are hyped all the time. They're pumped up on caffeine.

attributes.action: Limit motorway road works to 1 junction at a time.
attributes.background: With the current influx of ‚Äúsmart‚Äù motorways being installed around the country, we have seen neverending roadworks for miles and miles. The current spate of roadworks on the M6 between Jncs 19 and 16 are causing mayhem and misery daily. Accidents occur daily and yet work won‚Äôt be done till 2019
attributes.additional_details: I am proposing the government stop Highways England from installing road works for more than one junction at a time. Where the next junction is longer than 5 miles away then the limit be 5 miles. The lanes are too narrow and the lack of a hard shoulder in the inevitable outcome of an incident impedes emergency services and creates hours of tail backs. All to help protect workers which is all well and good if they were actually working on that stretch.

attributes.action: Make it that front number plates do not have to be shown on a motor vehicle
attributes.background: Make it so that on a motor vehicle that you don‚Äôt have to display a front number plate.

attributes.action: Create"National Unity Day" UK-wide bank holiday to celebrate all that unites us.
attributes.background: We believe the United Kingdom needs a day that celebrates and promotes the fabric of what our great country was built upon - Unity. With our nation more divided than ever, we need a day that will bring us together to celebrate all that we have in common.
attributes.additional_details:
For more details visit:
www.Diversify.org

attributes.action: Make hoax callers to emergency services pay ¬£200 fine or a prison sentence
attributes.background: Over the past year, Wiltshire emergency services had over 1,000 hoax calls, and because they have a duty of care, they have to go to every call, so whilst there attending the hoax calls, there's hundreds of people that need an ambulance
attributes.additional_details: I believe, making sure every hoax call is investigated properly, there there should be a ¬£200 fine or a prison sentence,  and if it's a child doing it, then the parents should pay it, or the child do some kind of community service,

attributes.action: Make all advertisers state if their images have been doctored.
attributes.background: Both France and Israel have made it law that advertisers must put on their packaging that their images have been doctored. This is to stop the presentation of false body image. Britain should follow in their example.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, there have been instances where celebrities such as Kate Winlslet have made it public that images of them have been doctored. It should not be up to the models and celebrities to state this. There are countless doctored images that the public aren't aware about, that are constantly thrown in our faces. Advertisers should clearly state that their images have been doctored, as this can give some people the need to get the perfect body, which is obviously made up by some advertisers.

attributes.action: Ban mobile operators from taking payments for phone purchases you've paid off.
attributes.background: Monthly payments for a new mobile contract will often include the service charges and a cost to cover a new phone. Once your contract term expires, and if you do not contact the operator, you will automatically continue paying the same monthly cost despite having paid off the loan for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is the same as buying a new car on finance and being expected to continue your payments once the loan is paid off. 

The majority of consumers may be aware of the practice and renegotiate their contracts, however, many others do not realise that part of their monthly cost is effectively a loan for the phone. 

Standard industry practice should be to automatically move consumers to SIM only when their contract expires or phone is paid off, whichever occurs first.

attributes.action: Require routine scans for head and neck cancer patients after remission
attributes.background: Head and neck cancer patients are not routinely scanned after remission due to protocol. Even though a certain amount of patients have had metastasis from this source of cancer, which has gone from a highly curable cancer to a terminal diagnosis. Scans every 3-6 months should be a requirement.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 Andrew Davis was diagnosed with SCC of the tonsil. He underwent 30 radiotherapy and 1 chemotherapy. He was then given the all clear in June 2016. After this his life started to get better. In June 2017, Andrew became unwell and was given the news he had Secondary Liver Mets, no evidence of disease in head and neck area but the cells in his liver were from that source that had broken away during treatment. We are petitioning for head and neck patients to be scanned routinely.

attributes.action: Carbon monoxide detectors in student accommodation and lettings
attributes.background:
My daughter has just moved into a student flat were we found no carbon monoxide detectors, which I thought would be a legal requirement. But after speaking to the letting company they told me that they there's no legal requirement for them.
We all know the consequences of a carbon monoxide leak...
attributes.additional_details:
This is what I received from Save the Student when I put the question to them regarding the law...
They are only legally required for any room containing a solid fuel burning appliance, and not for Gas appliances. However gas boilers can emit carbon monoxide, and the government say "we would expect and encourage reputable landlords to ensure that working carbon monoxide alarms are installed in rooms with gas boilers". So we advise you put strong pressure on the agent to do the right thing.
